block.p: RALCORP HOLDINGS INC., St. Louis, a maker of private-label crackers and cereal, announced it would buy back as many as 5 million shares at a price of $14 to $16 in a Dutch tender offer.

THOMAS NELSON INC., Nashville, the world's No. 1 publisher of Bibles, said it would cut 100 jobs and sell or shut some of its Connecticut operations as the company restructures its C. R. Gibson Co. gift products unit.
RALCORP HOLDINGS INC., St. Louis, a maker of private-label crackers and cereal, announced it would buy back as many as 5 million shares at a price of $14 to $16 in a Dutch tender offer.

THOMAS NELSON INC., Nashville, the world's No. 1 publisher of Bibles, said it would cut 100 jobs and sell or shut some of its Connecticut operations as the company restructures its C. R. Gibson Co. gift products unit.

STEWART & STEVENSON SERVICES INC., Houston, a maker of diesel and gas turbine powered vehicles and equipment, received a multiyear contract valued at more than $1.4 billion to produce 2.5- and 5-ton trucks for the Army.
HASBRO INC., Pawtucket, R.I., the toy and game maker, said it had received regulatory approval for its $220 million acquisition of Galoob Toys Inc., a toy maker based in San Francisco.
